title: Sectional Mock 9 - English
instruction: Read the given passage and answer the following questions based on the passage. If the evidence is clear and present, then not acting on it would be a chilling demonstration of inability and inefficiency, and the lack of will to bring about change. There should be no doubt that educating a woman serves a larger ameliorative purpose. The recently released Health Ministry survey that showed a direct correlation between the nutritional status of children and their mothers’ education is a further stroke for the case of women’s education. The Comprehensive National Nutrition Survey, which studied 1.2 lakh children between 2016-18, measured diet diversity, meal frequency and minimum acceptable diet as ______________________(A)_______________________________. It demonstrated that with higher levels of schooling for a mother, her children received better diets. On two counts, meal diversity and minimum acceptable diet, and in terms of bolstering food with micro nutrients, the children of mothers with better education did well. The data is revelatory: Only 11.4% of children of mothers with no schooling received adequately diverse meals, while 31.8% whose mothers finished Class XII received diverse meals. While 9.6% of children whose mothers had finished schooling got minimum acceptable diets, only 3.9% of children whose mothers had zero schooling got such a diet. Development economists have long studied the role that education of girls plays in enabling them to emerge as agents of change. Empirical work in recent years, Nobel laureate Amartya Sen reasons, has clearly shown how the relative aspect and regard for women’s well being is strongly influenced by women’s literacy and educated participation in decisions within and outside the family. In the late 1990s, Tamil Nadu along with the Danish International Development Agency, launched a mass rural literacy project in Dharmapuri, then considered backward, riding largely on local leaders, most of them women. Evaluation showed overall salubrious effects on the community within a short while. Implemented largely through the employ of the local arts, one measure of success, as recorded then, was an increased outpatient attendance in primary health centres. There is a body of compelling evidence for the government to focus on improving female literacy. In Census 2011, the female literacy rate was 65.46%, much lower than for males, at 82.14%. States such as Kerala with a high literacy rate (male and female) also sit at the top of the table on development indicators. As former American First Lady Michelle Obama said, “Because we know that when girls are educated, their countries become stronger and more prosperous.” No other task can assume greater urgency for a nation striving to improve its performance on all fronts.

quiz.text: What would be the aftereffects of Brexit mentioned in the given passage?
options: Northern Ireland administered by the Democratic Unionist Party.
Setting up of tactile boundary between the Ireland.
Amendment in the Good Friday agreement.
Tories’ being appointed as the secular head of EU.
None of these

quiz.text: What are the views of experts on the signing of Brexit deal?
options: Britain would proliferate
Dwindling of trade boundaries
Impoverishment of UK
Both [b] and [c]
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following statement(s) are true as per the given passage?
options: DUP was in approbation of the deal.
Labour and Liberal Democrats demand a general vote with respect to the deal.
Johnson deal is out of question as per the MPs.
Both [b] and [c]
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following word(s) means the same as “ inescapable”? (i)impalpable (ii)insubstantial (iii)inexorable (iv)inevitable
options: Both (i) and (iv)
Only (iv)
Both (iii) and (iv)
(i), (ii) and (iii)
All of these

quiz.text: Which of the following option express the meaning of the phrase “plug every loophole”?
options: The electrician plugged the system in every loophole to check for the electricity.
In the situation it was a compulsion to plug every loophole for the candidate to win.
The dramatic entry of the actor to plug every loophole on the stage was mesmerizing.
Don’t plug every loophole, otherwise the party would be ruined.
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following phrase would best fit in the blank (I) as mentioned in the passage?
options: Situating Belfast an the bottom most place of the developed city.
the benefits of the deal are by far in favor all European nations
Britain is in the far west of the continent Europe.
reaping the benefits of membership of the EU and retaining its status within Great Britain
None of these

quiz.text: Fast foods ar  unhealthy (1)/ for the reason that they are full of neurotoxin, (2)/ monosodium glutamate (MSG) which is used as a preservative (3)/ and to enhance flavour. (4)/ All correct (5)
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: The reversal of wind during the winter (1)/ and summer monsoon makes deep-sea navi­gation (2)/ comparitively simple by sailing with wind tech­niques (3)/, and there are no treacherous currents.(4)/ All correct (5)
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: Monosodium glutamate has numerous side effects akin (1)/ to headaches, chest pain, sweating, heart palpitations (2)/, nausea and weakness (3)/; some claim it hinders thinking clearly.(4)/ All correct (5)
options: 1
2
3
4
5

quiz.text: With rich resources in the Indian Ocean (1)/ and in the littoral states (2)/, such a possibility has added an additional dimension (3)/ to the geopolitical strategy of the region.(4)/ All correct (5)
options: 2
1
5
4
3

quiz.text: Scientists said on Wednesday they had (11) down the oldest known lizard, a tiny creature that lived about 240 million years ago when Earth had a single continent and dinosaurs were brand new. Scans of the fossilized skeleton of Megachirella (12) the chameleon-sized reptile was an ancestor of today’s lizards and snakes, which belong to a group called squamates, an international team (13) in the science journal Nature. This finding (14) the group back in time by 75 million years, and means that “lizards (15) the planet since at least 240 million years ago,” study co-author Tiago Simoes of the University of Alberta in Canada said. That, in turn, suggested that squamates had already split from other ancient reptiles before the Permian/Triassic mass extinction some 252 million years ago, and survived it. Up to 95% of marine- and 75% of terrestrial life on earth was lost. Megachirella, (16) some 20 years ago buried in (17) sand and clay layers in the Dolomites mountain range in northeast Italy, was initially misclassified as a close lizard relative. But Mr. Simoes had questions. “When I first saw the fossil, I (18) it had important features that could link it to the early evolution of lizards,” he said. So, he hooked up with colleagues to perform a more (19) analysis of the tiny skeleton, which included CT scanning. The scans revealed previously unseen physical features, including the underside of the fossil, (20) in rock. The team found a tiny bone in Megachirella’s lower jaw that is unique to the squamate family.
options: founded
tracked
footprinted
overlooked
passed

options: closed

quiz.text: What can be inferred from the given passage?
options: Sitting on the top of development, Kerala has the highest literacy rate.
By educating a woman, one educate the current generation and the generations to come.
There is evidence of the overall benefits that accrue from investing in women’s education

quiz.text: Which of the following phrase fits in the blank (A) to form a grammatically and contextually correct sentence?
options: definitely determine the amount of body mass in the infants and young children.
structural basis for the temperament of youth and females.
per the census of 2010 the decease in the mental health of women and young children
the three core indicators of nutritional deficiency among infants and young children.

options: vitiate
salutary
transpire
empathetic

quiz.text: Which of the following words mean the opposite of the word “salubrious” as used in the passage? (i) deleterious (ii) pernicious (iii) noxious (iv) innocuous
options: Both (i) and (ii)
Only (ii)
(i), (ii) and (iii)

All of these

quiz.text: What did the survey done by Health Ministry indicated as per the given passage?

Direct correlation of the nutritional status of the child with the educated mother.
Both [b] and [c]
None of these
